questions.text: An increase in calcium conductance is associated with all of the following except?

options.label: A
options.text: Plateau phase of the ventricular muscle action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Upstroke of the smooth muscle action potential

questions.correct_answer: B. Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

questions.text: A 37-year-old woman presents with severe migraine headaches that are accompanied by hemipareisis. Genetic analysis confirms the suspicion of an inherited channelopathy. The membrane potential will depolarize by the greatest amount if the membrane permeability increases for which of the following ions?
At which point on the nerve action potential shown in the figure given below is the membrane closest to the equilibrium potential for sodium?
Which of the following characteristics of an axon is most dependent on its diameter?

options.label: C
options.text: Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.text: A 65-year-old woman is in the second post operative day after a hysterectomy. She suddenly stands after being supine since the day of the operation. As a result, which of the following hemodynamic variables will increase?

A 25-year-old man presents to his physician for an annual physical examination. He instructs the subject to take a deep inspiration. During this manoeuvre, the physician detects a splitting of the second heart sound. Which of the following is the mechanism underlying this finding?

options.label: C
options.text: Delayed closing of the aortic valve

options.label: D
options.text: Delayed closing of the pulmonary valve

questions.correct_answer: D. Delayed closing of the pulmonary valve

questions.text: Which of the following organs has the highest arterio-venous oxygen differences under normal conditions?

The phases of the cardiac action potential are represented by the lettered points on the diagram below. At which point on the action potential is the membrane potential most dependent on calcium permeability?
A 45-year-old man with mitral prolapse is admitted to the hospital for evaluation of his cardiac function. Which of the following is the best indicator of the cardiac preload?
questions.correct_answer: D. Left ventricular end diastolic volume

questions.text: During which interval of the ECG does the aortic valve close?

An 80-year-old man presents with dyspnoea, which worsens with exertion. The cardiologist orders an echocardiogram, BNP and ANP levels to evaluate possible cardiac failure. Which of the following is most likely to occur with ANP?

options.label: B
options.text: ANP secretion increases with increase in central venous pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. ANP secretion increases with increase in central venous pressure

questions.text: A 43-year-old man presents with c/o exhaustion and shortness of breath. After completing his physical examination, the cardiologist suspects that the patient may be suffering from cardiac tamponade. Which of the following observations led to this conclusion?

A patient with MI develops progressive dyspnea and hypoxemia suggestive of cardiogenic shock. She is transferred to the ICU and a Swan-Ganz catheter is inserted. The patient is found to have a pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 30 mm Hg, which is indicative of a decrease in which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.correct_answer: D. Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy has a fall from his cycle and sustains a skull fracture which compresses the underlying brain tissue. Which of the following will occur in response to an increased intracranial pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood pressure and heart rate increase

options.label: B
options.text: Blood pressure and heart rate decrease

options.label: C
options.text: Blood pressure increases and heart rate decreases

options.label: D
options.text: Blood pressure decreases and heart rate increases

questions.correct_answer: C. Blood pressure increases and heart rate decreases

questions.text: An 80-year-old man is brought to the Emergency with complaints of nausea, vomiting, muscle cramps, and generalized weakness. Laboratory analysis reveals significant hyperkalemia. Elevations of extracellular potassium ion concentration will have which of the following effects on the nerve membranes?

options.label: C
options.text: Activity of the Na+- K+ ATPase will decrease

questions.text: Which of the following will occur if blood flow to an alveolus is totally obstructed by a pulmonary thromboembolism?

options.label: A
options.text: V/Q ratio of the alveolus equals zero

options.label: B
options.text: Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

options.label: C
options.text: Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to the mixed venous Po 2

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in shunting in the lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Po 2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

questions.text: A 70-year-old male with emphysema presents for his annual pulmonary function testing to assess the progression of the disease. As a result of alveolar septal departitioning in emphysema, there is a decrease in which of the following?

An 18-year-old male is brought to the Emergency after being thrown from his motorcycle following a collision with a stationary truck. It is determined that he has a brain transection above the pons. How will this lesion affect the control of breathing in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: He loses voluntary control over his respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Central chemoreceptors will no longer be able to exert any control over the ventilation

options.label: D
options.text: Involuntary control over respiration will be lost but voluntary control will be present

questions.correct_answer: B. He loses voluntary control over his respiration

questions.text: A 36-year-old male suffers from third degree burns over 70% of his body. His effective circulating volume and renal perfusion pressure drop precipitously and the concentration of NaCl in the tubular fluid in the kidney decreases. These conditions will cause an increase in which of the following by the kidney?

A 20-year-old healthy male suddenly develops shortness of breath and fatigue. A chest X-ray reveals pneumothorax of the right lung possibly due to rupture of a bleb on the surface of the lung. Which of the following changes occur on lung function because of pneumothorax?

options.label: A
options.text: Intrapleural pressure in the affected area equals the atmospheric pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Chest wall on the affected side recoils inward

options.label: D
options.text: Mediastinum shifts to the affected side with each inspiration

questions.correct_answer: A. Intrapleural pressure in the affected area equals the atmospheric pressure

questions.text: An 80-year-old man resents with polyuria and polydipsia. Blood analysis reveals hypernatremia and urinanalysis shows hypotonicity with increased free water clearance. In which of the following conditions is an increased free water clearance a hallmark of the disease?

When the respiratory drive for increased pulmonary ventilation becomes greater than normal, a special set of neurons that are inactive during normal breathing then become active, contributing to the respiratory drive. These neurons are located in which of the following?
The cardiovascular responses to isotonic exercise include an increase in which of the following?
A spirometer can be used to directly measure which of the following?

An 18-year-old woman presents with an increased frequency of asthma exacerbations over the previous year. At the time of her visit, her physical examination and flow- volume loop are normal. At which point on the flow- volume loop given below will the airflow remain constant despite an increased respiratory effort?

A 15-year-old adolescent boy is being treated with the macrolide antibiotic erythromycin complains of nausea, intestinal cramping, and diarrhoea. The side effects are the result of the antibiotic binding to receptors in the GI tract that recognize which gastrointestinal hormone?

A 25-year-old woman c/o abdominal cramps and bloating relieved by defecation. Subsequent clinical evaluation reveals an increased maximal acid output, decreased serum calcium and iron concentrations and microcytic anemia. Inflammation in which of the following areas of the GI tract best explains these findings?
Cortisone is administered to a woman for treatment of an autoimmune disorder. Which of the following is likely in this patient?

A 20-year-old man presents to the Emergency with shortness of breath. His OHDC was shifted from that for normal hemoglobin A depicted in the curve A in the figure given below to curve B. this finding is consistent with which of the following conditions?
questions.correct_answer: D. Recent transfusion with banked blood

questions.text: A 70-year-old man has a solid tumour that pushes against an airway, partially obstructing the airflow to the distal alveoli. Which point on the V/Q line of the O 2 - CO 2 diagram given below corresponds to the alveolar gas of the distal alveoli?
Parathormone increases calcium reabsorption in which of the following points along the nephron?
All of the following would be expected to increase the mean systemic filling pressure except?
Compared with arterial red blood cells, which of the following best describes the venous red blood cells?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased intracellular chloride concentration, decreased cell volume

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased intracellular chloride concentration, decreased cell volume

options.label: D
options.text: Increased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

questions.text: A 46-year-old man presents with a 12-week history of frontal headaches. A CT scan of the brain shows a mass in the posterior pituitary, and the posterior pituitary “bright spot” is absent on MRI. The patient also complains of increased thirst and waking up frequently during the night. Which of the following best describes the urine?

options.label: A
options.text: A higher-than-normal flow of hypotonic urine

options.label: B
options.text: A higher-than-normal flow of hypertonic urine

options.label: C
options.text: A lower-than-normal flow of hypotonic urine

options.label: D
options.text: A lower-than-normal flow of hypertonic urine

questions.correct_answer: A. A higher-than-normal flow of hypotonic urine

questions.text: When compared with the late-evening values typically observed in normal individuals, plasma levels of both ACTH and cortisol would be expected to be higher in which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal individuals after waking in the morning

options.label: B
options.text: Normal individuals who have taken dexamethasone

questions.correct_answer: A. Normal individuals after waking in the morning

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy with weakness affecting the proximal muscles is found to have a mutation of a gene that encodes for the protein dystrophin. Genetic alteration in dystrophin lead to progressive muscle weakness because dystrophin provides structural support to the sarcolemma by binding with which of the following?

A 36-year-old woman is found comatose in her kitchen by her husband and is brought to the Emergency of a nearby hospital. Blood gas analysis reveals normal Po2 and a lower-than-normal arterial O2 saturation. Which of the following conditions is most consistent with the findings?

A 60-year-old woman has osteoporosis, hypertension, hirsuitism and hyperpigmentation. MRI indicates that the pituitary gland of the patient is not enlarged. Which of the following is the most consistent with these findings?

A 30-year-old man is resting and there is a sudden increase in his sympathetic discharge to maximal values. All of the following set of changes would be expected in response to this increased sympathetic output except?

At birth, a large, well-nourished baby is found to have a plasma glucose concentration of 17 mg/dL and a plasma insulin concentration that is twice the normal. Which of the following is the best explanation for these findings?

options.label: C
options.text: Mother is diabetic, with poorly controlled hyperglycemia

questions.correct_answer: C. Mother is diabetic, with poorly controlled hyperglycemia

questions.text: A 56-year-old man with hypertension presents with complaints of flushing and orthostatic hypertension. Blood analysis reveals an increased renin activity and hyperlipidemia. Gadolinum- enhanced three-dimensional MRI is suggestive of renal artery stenosis. Measurement of renal blood flow and a renal arteriogram are ordered to evaluate the patient for atherosclerotic renal vascular disease. The effective renal plasma flow determined from the clearance of PAHA is less than the true of actual RPF because of which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Fraction of PAH filtered is less than the filtration fraction

options.label: B
options.text: Plasma entering the renal vein contains a small amount of PAHA

options.label: C
options.text: CD is unable to absorb small amount of the PAHA

options.label: D
options.text: True RPF depends on the urine flow rate

questions.correct_answer: B. Plasma entering the renal vein contains a small amount of PAHA

questions.text: Which of the following vasoactive agents is usually the most important controller of coronary blood flow?
After secretion of trypsinogen into the duodenum, the enzyme is converted into its active form, trypsin, by which of the following?
Which of the following graphs best describes the relationship between Pco2 and alveolar ventilation (VA), when the Pco2 is changed acutely over a range of 35 to 75 mm Hg?
Inhibition of the sodium iodide symport would be expected to cause which of the following?
In addition to increasing the permeability of the collecting ducts to water, ADH increases the permeability of the collecting ducts to which of the following?

A 45-year-old woman presents with complaints of excessive bleeding during her periods and increasing fatigue and cold extremities. Laboratory investigations reveal a Hb of 6gm/dL. In this patient with anemia, which of the following would be reduced?

options.label: C
options.text: Percent O 2 saturation in the arterial blood

questions.text: In the maximal expiratory flow- volume loops given below, loop A would be typical of which of the following clinical presentations?

options.label: A
options.text: A 75-year-old man who has smoked two packets of cigarettes per day for 60 years. His breath sounds are decreased bilaterally, and his chest X-ray shows flattening of the diaphragm

options.label: B
options.text: A 68-year-old man presents with a dry cough that has persisted for 3 months. His chest X-ray shows opacities in the lower and middle lung fields. The man states that he was exposed to asbestos for approximately 10 years when he worked in a factory in his thirties

options.label: C
options.text: A 57-year-old woman with pulmonary fibrosis who presents to the Emergency with shortness of breath

options.label: D
options.text: An 85-year-old woman with h/o MI who reports shortness of breath that worsens in the recumbent position

questions.correct_answer: A. A 75-year-old man who has smoked two packets of cigarettes per day for 60 years. His breath sounds are decreased bilaterally, and his chest X-ray shows flattening of the diaphragm

questions.text: The renal clearance of phosphate is increased by which of the following hormones?
All of the following regarding airway resistance are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: Airway resistance is greater in medium sized airways than in the smaller sized airways

options.label: B
options.text: Airway resistance is greater with turbulent airflow than with laminar airflow

options.label: C
options.text: Airway resistance is more during expiration than during inspiration

options.label: D
options.text: Airways resistance is more at high lung volumes than at low lung volumes

questions.correct_answer: D. Airways resistance is more at high lung volumes than at low lung volumes

questions.text: Which of the following is not produced by osteoblasts?

A 35-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with severe kyphoscoliosis and respiratory muscle weakness. Which of the following physiological variables is most likely to be decreased in this patient?

A 23-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital in labour. Her blood pressure is 130/85 mm Hg and creatinine is 2.7mg/dL. Renal USG reveals bilateral hydronephrosis. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the elevated creatinine level in this patient?

A 50-year-old male with small cell carcinoma of the lung presents with lethargy, confusion and muscle cramps. Lab investigations reveal elevated ADH levels, possible from the ectopic production of ADH. In patients with SIADH, which of the following will increase?

A 45-year-old woman has a mass in the sella turcica that compresses the portal vessels, disrupting pituitary access to hypothalamic secretions. The secretion rate of which hormone would most likely increase in this patient?

A 15-year-old boy playing in his garden accidentally steps on a broken bottle with his bare right foot. His right leg immediately lifts up while his left leg extends even before he cries out in pain. Which of the following best describes the type of reflex and the centre involved in this reflex?

A 43-year-old man sustained a lower back injury that causes severe chronic pain. His physician prescribes analgesics for the pain and benzodiazepines to help him sleep. Which of the following best describes why this man has difficulty sleeping without medication?

options.label: A
options.text: Excitation of amygdala by slow pain fibres

options.label: B
options.text: Excitation of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

options.label: C
options.text: Depression of amygdala by slow pain fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Depression of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

questions.correct_answer: B. Excitation of reticular formation by slow pain fibres

questions.text: Tapping the patellar tendon elicits a reflex contraction of the quadriceps muscle. Which of the following occurs during the contraction of the quadriceps muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Ib afferents from the golgi tendon organ increase their rate of firing

options.label: B
options.text: Ia afferents from the muscle spindle increase their rate of firing

options.label: C
options.text: A? motor neurons to the antagonist muscles increase their rate of firing

options.label: D
options.text: A? motor neurons to the intrafusal muscle fibres increase their rate of firing

questions.correct_answer: B. Ia afferents from the muscle spindle increase their rate of firing

questions.text: A 20-year-old man, victim of road traffic accident is brought to the Emergency and is diagnosed with hemisection of the left side of the spinal cord at C6. Which of the following function is likely to be lost in the right leg of this man?

A 15-year-old boy fell from his bicycle and sustained a head injury. He develops a fever of 39 degrees Celsius which is unrelated to an infection or inflammation. The fever is most likely due to a lesion of which of the following?
Precentral gyrus, corticospinal and corticobulbar tracts are essential for which of the following?
Synaptic transmission between the pain fibres from the viscera in the pelvis to spinal cord neurons is mediated by which of the following?

An 85-year-old man is waiting in the pre-op room where the air temperature is 21 degrees Celsius. He is wearing only a thin gown that is open at the back. Most of his body heat will be lost by which of the following mechanisms?

An 86-year-old woman presents with hemipareisis that has worsened over the past three days. Examination reveals increased tone, hyperreflexia, Babinski sign positive on the affected side. Babinski sign elicited by the physician indicates damage to which of the following?

A 59-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital because of agitation and aggression. Three years prior to admission, her irregular, flicking movements had become so severe that she could not walk or look after herself. Hutington chorea affects which of the following areas of the brain?

A 48-year-old woman with multiple sclerosis and increasing spasticity is treated with an intrathecal infusion of baclofen, a GABAB agonist which mediates pre-synaptic inhibition. Presynaptic inhibition in the CNS affects the firing rate of ?-motor neurons by which of the following mechanisms?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing the potassium permeability of the pre-synaptic nerve ending

options.label: B
options.text: Increasing the potassium permeability of the ?-motor neuron

options.label: C
options.text: Hyperpolarizing the membrane potential of the ?-motor neuron

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing the amount of neurotransmitter released by the pre-synaptic membrane

questions.correct_answer: A. Increasing the potassium permeability of the pre-synaptic nerve ending

questions.text: The circadian rhythm is controlled by which hypothalamic nucleus?
Compared with arterial red blood cells, which of the following best describes the venous red blood cells?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased intracellular chloride concentration, decreased cell volume

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased intracellular chloride concentration, decreased cell volume

options.label: D
options.text: Increased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased intracellular chloride concentration, increased cell volume

questions.text: A 50-year-old patient with a past h/o cirrhosis undergoes a total colectomy. Removal of the entire colon would be expected to cause which of the following?

If the extracellular concentration of calcium is 100mmol/L and intracellular concentration is 1 millimole/ L and 2.3RT/F = 60mV, what is the equilibrium potential of calcium (cell membrane is freely permeable to calcium)?

A group of university students visit Khardungla at 5600 metres. On arrival, few of the students experience mental and muscle fatigue, and complain of headaches, nausea, and dyspnea. Which of the following will be decreased in these patients?
If helium oxygen mixture rather than nitrogen-oxygen mixture is given to a deep sea diver, which of the following will be observed?

options.label: A
options.text: Risk of decompression sickness is reduced

options.label: B
options.text: Risk of O 2 toxicity is reduced

questions.correct_answer: A. Risk of decompression sickness is reduced

questions.text: A 22- year-old man is planning to run the 10k when he goes to visit his brother in Leh. Because of the high altitude, he decides to leave early for the event. While in Leh, he experiences extensive cramping and spasms in his calf muscles while running, symptoms he seldom experienced in Delhi. Lab tests reveal hypocalcemia. Which of the following is the reason high altitude predisposes to tetany?

options.label: A
options.text: Low oxygen tension decreases his skeletal muscle blood flow

options.label: B
options.text: Low oxygen tension increases the skeletal muscle lactate

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma proteins are more ionized under alkalotic conditions which provide more protein anion to bind with Ca ++

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation of the sodium-potassium ATPase reduces the plasma concentration of free ionized calcium

questions.correct_answer: C. Plasma proteins are more ionized under alkalotic conditions which provide more protein anion to bind with Ca ++

questions.text: Surgical resection of the terminal ileum is most likely to result in which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in the absorption of amino acids

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in the fat content in the feces

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in water content of the feces

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in the absorption of iron

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase in water content of the feces

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents with the chief complaint of intermittent mid-epigastric pain that is relieved by antacids or eating. Gastric analysis reveals that basal and maximal acid outputs exceed normal values. The gastric acid hypersecretion can be explained by an increase in the plasma concentration of which of the following?
